9C14DA7BB2514D0D9A847C84A5598957.description: dentify some of the services in the community for which the government and/or community is responsible (e.g., postal service, police services, fire services, hospitals, garbage collection, ploughing), and describe key responsibilities of people in the community in relation to those services

BD90DA0643724047ACEFD60DBA735C6E.description: demonstrate the ability to construct simple maps of places they have visited, using symbols and non-standard units (e.g., use different symbols to show the location of the play, picnic, and walking areas

FE724D01DD2E49FB826707B93501059F.description: demonstrate an understanding of some common non-standard units of measurement

E8B0D6C6FF5A413EA06D3F00206476BE.description: demonstrate an understanding of the basic elements of a map

377E6C6206E24CE8BF985B8DA029A5D5.description: describe the location of some significant places in their community, using relative location

CFC297483CC044029DEF6535F5C496A7.description: identify some distinct areas in the local community

B3307FDF95354BA59C103205A9C5E302.description: identify some of the natural and built features of their community

08DFC496193242C1A5AA8778B629E1B7.description: identify the traditional Indigenous and treaty territory or territories on which their school is located

0073D7430D7249308DE6C16494EC38D7.description: Understanding Context: The Elements of the Local Community

CC1B851944D04ECFB4462BDBB0CDFC1E.description: communicate the results of their inquiries using appropriate vocabulary

C96421B3FE5E45DAAA0DBA639757C36C.description: evaluate evidence and draw conclusions about some aspects of the interrelationship between people and natural and built features of their local community, and some of the effects of this interrelationship

D11AD0C3ABE04BA5B3188D5B10866F9B.description: interpret and analyse information and data relevant to their investigations, using a variety of tools

7D84A2E4181443C181907CF4D0A1F330.description: analyse maps, and construct simple maps using appropriate elements, as part of their investigations into the interrelationship between people and significant natural and built features in their community

DF01CF84D6954AF6A58A6E025038FD56.description: gather and organize information on the interrelationship between people and the natural and built features of their community, and on the effects of this interrelationship, using sources that they have located themselves or that have been provided to them

8C4B69A7A7DD4E40A07C60BEAD5B3F68.description: formulate questions to guide investigations into some aspects of the interrelationship between people and the natural and built features of their community, with a focus on some of the short- and long-term effects of this interrelationship

811DE9A0E5834846B0D8767DE7F68C00.description: Inquiry: Interrelationships and Their Impact - use the social studies inquiry process to investigate some aspects of the interrelationship between people and different natural and built features of their local community, with a focus on significant short- and long-term effects of this interrelationship

37F35CDF62C64693AAC6C07B84C7E187.description: create a plan that outlines some specific ways in which they can responsibly interact with the built and/or natural environment

CAF3C204C2F04FB1ACEC75F328B469A7.description: identify some services and service-related occupations in their community and describe how they meet people's needs, including their own needs

FA5BA53FD76F4F16A958590F5076345A.description: describe some of the ways in which people interact with the natural environment and the built features of, and human services in, the local community to meet their needs, and what might happen if these features/services did not exist

FDE1377C8015442FAAFE0B14E0B83058.description: Interrelationships within the Community - describe some aspects of the interrelationship between people and the natural and built features of their community

7013D8CC2D504C338DF2F5E68DD8B5A7.description: People and Environments: The Local Community

B5CA9CF9C1864F2E8AEFDC2455D886EB.description: demonstrate an understanding that it is important to treat other people and the environment with respect

F4BAC5803688460AB4C2AD2AB90D9F73.description: identify some elements of positive and inclusive behaviour and actions that they can practise in their everyday life and/or that other people practise

22A5EE6C35704D449B38323E91B3E556.description: demonstrate an understanding of simple chronology by identifying and organizing chronologically some significant events related to their personal experience

FE814ED0B27D4B149AAC5A08AEE3F29D.description: identify some of the significant people, places, and things in their life, including their life in the community, and describe their purpose or the role they have

4CA5A44564674625960E48CC3CDCF060.description: describe some of their own roles, relationships, and responsibilities

9466FED2DA444CFE856D10A8B9253080.description: Understanding Context: Roles, Relationships, and Respect - demonstrate an understanding that they and other people experience a range of different roles, relationships, and responsibilities, and that all people and the environment should be treated with respect

34EF7089C61440909EBFC6B559B6C502.description: communicate the results of their inquiries using appropriate vocabulary

F2E4465083EB45D0B7C37E53DBCAB363.description: evaluate evidence and draw conclusions about some aspects of the interrelationship between events, people, and/or places in their lives and their own roles, relationships, responsibilities, and identity/sense of self

259F18FA56814857A6D2265DE9BB7365.description: interpret and analyse information relevant to their investigations using a variety of tools

2B87796FD2B74116A650E148C6127BB9.description: analyse and construct simple maps as part of their investigations into places that are significant to them or to their family

F48FB53C613040A8B3EF5EDD082382CE.description: gather and organize information on significant events, people, and/or places in their lives that contribute or have contributed to the development of their roles, relationships, responsibilities, and identity/sense of self using primary and/or secondary sources that they have located themselves or that have been provided to them

5E7E0FD490BC47FD83AC5BD92B31957B.description: formulate questions to guide investigations into some aspects of the interrelationship  between events, people, and/or places in their lives and their own roles, relationships, responsibilities, andidentity/sense of self

45AC6EB471BD4BA3BDAD52D2AACAF055.description: Inquiry: Roles, Responsibilities, and Identity - use the social studies inquiry process to investigate some aspects of the interrelationship between their identity/sense of self21, their different roles, relationships, and responsibilities, and various situations in their daily lives

C32CE78502324987BA8F61538B2BCF66.description: identify some of the ways in which First Nations, Metis, and Inuit individuals and communities are reclaiming and revitalizing aspects of their identity that were lost or taken away due to colonization, including the residential school system and the role that these aspects play in their sense of self

CF74BF4728F1408FB8AE797C83204AB7.description: describe the impact that people can have on each other in some different situations and some of the ways in which interactions between people can affect a person's sense of self

D945BCC72C0340FEB1F9C467A53DC3F7.description: compare some of the significant events in their own lives and/or the lives of their family members with those in the lives of their peers

E49D296F143349A69B6BF97800B46E67.description: describe how some significant events in their lives

DB8BEAD7664C4EBC8CE48DC9052E75EC.description: describe how and why a person's roles, relationships, and responsibilities may change in different places or situations and at different times

E44EB0C12C7C4C15BFF9AE4CD7E9752B.description: Application: Why Roles and Responsibilities Change - describe some of the ways in which people's roles, relationships with, and responsibilities to others and the world around them relate to who they are and what their situation is, and how and why changes in circumstances might affect people's roles, relationships, and responsibilities as well as their sense of self

60FD81325ACA46A68BD7316FF84FD513.description: Heritage and Identity: Our Changing Roles and Responsibilities
